au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.control

Class AbstractBatchRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.control.AbstractBatchRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfiguredBatchRunner, TestConfiguredBatchRunner

    public abstract class AbstractBatchRunner
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Abstract class for batch control. Batch control in Sahara is run by invoking a system executable which does the batch control and (presumably) generates a results file. The following methods should be overridden for rig specific batch control.
    • init() - Should setup the command, arguments, working directory and execution environment.
    • checkFile() - Should provide a sanity check on the provided batch instruction file.
    • sync() - This is run after the completion of batch control and should do synchronisation of the generated results files to a persistent store.
    NOTE:The premise of uploading code and running it on a laboratory server is inherently insecure. Care must be taken with what is run, what may be generated, how it is cleaned up and with what permission the batch process is run with.

      • manualWorkingDir

        protected boolean manualWorkingDir
        Whether the working directory is manually set in the concrete class or automatically created using configuration information. If this is set to true the configuration property Batch_Working_Dir is ignored and the variables workingDirBase and workingDir must be set in the concrete class. The default is to automatically set the working directory.

      • workingDirBase

        protected java.lang.String workingDirBase
        Batch process working directory base (base has a new folder added to be set as the batch processes CWD.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Processes the batch control invocation performing the following steps, calling the listed methods:
        1. init() - Command, argument, working directory and environment setup.
        2. checkFile() - Instruction file test.
        3. invoke() - Process creation.
        4. sync() - Generated file synchronisation.
        6. clean() - Invocation cleanup.
        If a preceding method fails (returns false), successive methods in the stack are not called, except cleanup() which is always called.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • init

        protected abstract boolean init()
        Sets the required batch control process variables. The variables that should be set in this method are:
        • command - The batch command name executable name.
        • commandArgs - The command line arguments to provide for the command. The arguments are provided in the same order as they are entered into the commandArgs list. NOTE: You should add the fileName field as a parameter for the command since this contains an absolute reference to the uploaded instruction file.
        • workingDirBase - The working directory base for the batch command process. If not set, the default base is the system temporary directory. The base is appended with a new folder to contain the results files from the batch executable (assuming it puts the files in its current working directory.)
        • envMap - Environment variable map for the batch process environment. Additions to this will be appended to the default environment variables.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • checkFile

        protected abstract boolean checkFile()
        Provides a sanity check on the provided batch instruction file. For example, it should check the file extension, file size and/or file magic number. It may also check the file extension and apply a transform. For example, if the extension is .gz, it may used GZIPInputStream to uncompress the file.
        Returns:
        true if the file passed the sanity check, false otherwise

      • invoke

        protected boolean invoke()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Invokes the batch control executable providing the instruction files as a command line parameter. Returns are invocation and does not wait for completion.
        Returns:
        true if the executable was successfully invoked
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception caused by starting the batch command

      • detectResultsFiles

        protected void detectResultsFiles()
        Detects results files by reading the list of files in the batch process working directory. This may be overridden to remove superfluous results files.

      • sync

        protected abstract boolean sync()
        This method is run after completion of the batch control executable and should do cleanup, if needed and file synchronisation to some persistent user accessible store, again if needed. This is provided as a utility with a guarantee that it is run only after the successful completion of the batch control executable.
        Returns:
        true if successfully completed

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminate the batch process.

      • cleanup

        protected void cleanup()
        Cleans up a batch control invocation.

      • getBatchStandardOut

        public java.lang.String getBatchStandardOut()
        Reads and returns the batch process standard output stream. null is returned if there is nothing to read. This returns the portion of the standard output stream which is between the end of the last read of the standard output stream and the end of the stream.

        NOTE: The standard output stream is buffered and may be accessed using getAllStandardOut.
        Returns:
        batch process standard out

      • getAllStandardOut

        public java.lang.String getAllStandardOut()
        Returns the captured standard out of the batch process.
        Returns:
        standard out

      • getBatchStandardError

        public java.lang.String getBatchStandardError()
        Reads and returns the batch process standard error stream. null is returned if there is nothing to read. This returns the portion of the standard error stream which is between the end of the last read of the standard error stream and the end of the stream.

        NOTE: The standard error stream is buffered and may be accessed using getAllStandardErr.
        Returns:
        batch process standard error

      • getAllStandardErr

        public java.lang.String getAllStandardErr()
        Returns the captured standard err of the batch process.

      • appendScrollback

        private int appendScrollback(java.lang.StringBuffer dest,
                   int destSize,
                   java.lang.StringBuilder src,
                   int srcSize)
        Appends a buffer to the destination buffer whilst not allowing the destination buffer to exceed the allowed buffer scroll back size.
        Parameters:
        dest - destination buffer
        destSize - the number of lines in the destination buffer
        src - the source to append into the destination
        srcSize - the number of lines in the source
        Returns:
        the new size of the destination

      • isInSetup

        public boolean isInSetup()
        Returns true if batch is in the process of being setup. This is true before the batch process has been started and false afterwards.
        Returns:
        true if in setup

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Returns true if a batch process has been started. Started is defined as when the command is called to fork a new process. This returns true irrespective if the batch process is started and running or if the batch process is started and complete.
        Returns:
        true if batch started, false otherwise

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if a batch process has been started and is currently running.
        Returns:
        true if batch is running, false otherwise

      • isFailed

        public boolean isFailed()
        Returns true if the batch invocation attempt has failed.
        Returns:
        true if batch failed

      • isKilled

        public boolean isKilled()
        Returns true if the batch invocation attempt has been killed.
        Returns:
        true if batch killed

      • getResultsFiles

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getResultsFiles()
        Returns the detected results files for a batch control invocation. Detected results files are those that are generated in the batch process working directory.
        Returns:
        list of generated results files

      • getExitCode

        public int getExitCode()
        Gets the exit code of the batch process. If the batch process has not completed, the returned exit code is 0.
        Returns:
        exit code
